metadata.case_name: Inayat Ali Khan & Ors. v. Respondent

facts.text: Appeals by special leave from judgments and orders dated March 25, 1968 and March 20, 1968 of the Allahabad High Court in Criminal Revision Nos. 528, 576 and 518 of 1967.
Appellant Inayat Ali Khan, a horse-breeder, received notice under Section 10(2) of the U.P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960 (U.P. Act 1 of 1961).
Appellant filed objections claiming certain plots used for growing grass or special types of crops as fodder for horses, relying on Section 6(xvii) of the Act as a specialised farm.
Prescribed Authority, Tahsil Sadar, held exemption not sustainable.

Additional District Judge, on appeal, concurred, observing that 'and' in Section 6(xvii) requires land to be used for specialised farm and exclusively devoted to specified purposes; fodder for non-dairy not exempt.
High Court (S.N. Singh, J.) held lower appellate court correctly interpreted the section.
Facts in Civil Appeals Nos. 2019 and 2020 of 1968 are similar.
Writ Petition 261 of 1968 challenging vires of Section 6 clause heard alongwith but disposed separately.

legal_issues.text: Interpretation of Section 6(xvii) of the U.P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960: whether land in specialised farm for horse-breeding (growing fodder for horses) is exempt, and whether 'and' should be read as 'or'.

petitioner_arguments.text: Word 'and' in Section 6(xvii) should be read as 'or' in context, entitling all specialised farms used for non-agricultural purposes to exemption.

respondent_arguments.text: Land must be included in specialised farm AND exclusively devoted to poultry farming or dairying or prescribed purposes; horse-breeding not included in Rule 4.
respondent_arguments.legal_basis: Section 6(xvii), Rule 4 under Section 44 of U.P. Act 1 of 1961

court_reasoning.text: No force in contention to read 'and' as 'or'; sub-clause specifies poultry farming and dairying, others left to rules under Section 44; Rule 4 prescribes sericulture etc., but not horse-breeding farms.

holdings.text: Horse-breeding farms not exempt under Section 6(xvii) as not devoted to poultry, dairying or prescribed purposes.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Imposition of Ceiling on Land Holdings Act, 1960 (U.P. Act 1 of 1961)
statutes_cited.relevance: Interpretation of exemption for specialised farms; notice and rules framed thereunder.

statutes_cited.name: Rule 4 under U.P. Act 1 of 1961
statutes_cited.relevance: Prescribes exemptions for sericulture, ericulture, lac culture, pisciculture; horse-breeding excluded.

outcome.summary: Civil Appeal No. 2018 of 1968 and similar appeals Nos. 2019 and 2020 fail; no exemption for horse-breeding farms under Section 6(xvii).

key_quotes.text: 'The word and in clause (xvii) of section 6 makes it clear that for purposes of exemption it is necessary that the land should be used for specialised farm and should be exclusively devoted to growing such articles or for such purposes as are specified in clause (xvii) and in Rule 4.'
key_quotes.speaker: lower_court
key_quotes.significance: Reasoning affirmed by Supreme Court on requirement for exemption.

key_quotes.text: We see no force in this contention. The sub-clause specially mentions two types of specialised farms, namely, those devoted to poultry farming and dairying. As regards others, it leaves them to be prescribed by rules under Section 44 of the Act.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Rejection of reading 'and' as 'or'; basis for dismissing appeals.
